reporting_cycle: Secretary-General and Panel of Experts reports: midterm report by 5 August 2015 and 7 September 2015, final report by 5 February 2016 and 7 March 2016
summary:
The Security Council adopted Resolution 2207 (2015) on 4 March 2015, recalling previous relevant resolutions and statements on the proliferation of nuclear, chemical, and biological weapons. The Council:

1. Extended the mandate of the Panel of Experts until 5 April 2016, with a review of the mandate to be conducted by 7 March 2016.

2. Requested the Panel to provide a midterm report to the Committee by 5 August 2015 and to the Council by 7 September 2015, and a final report to the Committee by 5 February 2016 and to the Council by 7 March 2016.

3. Asked the Panel to provide a planned program of work to the Committee within 30 days of reappointment and to provide updates as necessary.

4. Expressed its intent to continue following the work of the Panel.

5. Urged all States and relevant UN bodies to cooperate fully with the Committee and the Panel of Experts.

6. Decided to remain actively seized of the matter.
